column10: I was making the left turn onto Reston Pkwy from Bluemont Way when my light turned green. I thankfully did not go right away but as I pulled into the intersection, a woman between 25 and 35 years old blew through the intersection at approx. 50mph

column10: This is a very dangerous intersection, I walk my child to the children’s center on a daily basis and cars do not stop at the long crosswalk while crossing with a stroller. This has happened numerous times to numerous parents. Flashing lights are needed.; Cars,speeding,on,New,Dominion,Pkwy.,and,Explorer,St.,,right,in,front,of,a,Children’s,center.,Cars,do,not,stop,while,parents,are,crossing,with,stroller.,It,is,a,very,dangerous,intersection,and,there,needs,to,be,flashing,lights,for,the,crosswalk.

Market St. & Town Center Pkwy crosswalk needs flashing lights and additional signage as there is not sufficient warnings for this crosswalk, especially since all FCPS drop children there.; Car,passing,2,school,buses,when,stopped,to,drop,off,children.

Car speeding through clearly marked crosswalk.  I had to stop in the middle of the crosswalk with a stroller in order to not get hit, There needs to more signs/flashing lights as this is extremely dangerous and lots of parents with kids cross here!; New,Dominion,Pkwy.,&,Explorer,St.,,,clearly,marked,crosswalk,(Reston,,VA); Car,speeding,through,clearly,marked,crosswalk,as,I,was,walking,my,toddler,to,the,Children's,Center,with,a,stroller.
This is a consistent problem when families are walking their children to the daycare center. Nobody stops in the crosswalk. Ever!
Very poor visibility for cars travelling south on Old Reston Ave.  High risk of crashing into bicycles travelling southeast on W&OD.
Crossing Reston Parkway at Market St.

Yellow & red interval is too short for people walking and on bicycles to clear the intersection.  Right hand turning drivers jumped the green and harassed a person on a bike completing the crosswalk northbound and a family on bikes cutoff from entering the crosswalk southbound.
column21: Drivers from behind the first in the queue don't look for people walking or on bikes after the first one in the queue has gone right on red and jumped the green.
